file_content.text: You'll need to clear out the patrols before someone sees you meeting with the Padawan and reports it to her Masters.
I'm sorry, my lord. This was a terrible oversight on my part. Please forgive me.
My lord! I just heard that the Republic has increased patrols around the enclave.
Call the Padawan and lure her out with the promise of the holocron. Its dark side influence will do your work for you.
Make the deal with Lord Anathemos and lay your trap for the Padawan.
I've found the holocron.
Excellent news, my lord.
Excellent, my lord. Lord Anathemos can be found at the Empire's current outpost in that region. I suggest you speak with him right away.
And I'm pleased to say that I've found the perfect place for you to lure your Padawan to.
An area of swamp near enough to Republic territory that she'll feel secure, yet remote enough that she'll be truly at your mercy.
Good work.
Are you angling for some sort of prize here?
I suppose you expect a reward.
Certainly not. My duty is to serve.
Workaholic, much?
I am only doing my duty.
I suggest you contact the girl using a holocommunicator from a nearby Republic soldier.
In the past, Sith often used dark side holocrons to turn weak-willed Jedi. If you can convince the Padawan to look, she'll fall easily.
Have Lord Anathemos's assassins drive the girl to this spot, and then secure yourself a holocommunicator from a nearby Republic soldier.
Once the trap is sprung, you can call on a Republic frequency and offer help. Good luck.
The first thing we need is to retrieve the holocron from the abandoned outpost, my lord.
I found the databanks. Our Padawan has a bit of a pride problem. She is a less-than-perfect Jedi candidate.
Most excellent! In my experience, pride and insecurity go hand in hand. My lord, you went searching for crumbs and discovered a feast!
She feels as though the Jedi don't trust her strength. I must show her that I do.
We must make her like us.
Hmm. Yes. Excellent thinking. Promise her power, or wealth... something to win her trust.
Let me think, what could we use? It must be something tempting to a young Padawan....
I can be quite charming.
Let me handle it.
Let me handle it.
I have no doubt of it, my lord, but you are Sith. She will never trust you without encouragement....
Do you have any suggestions?
What are your thoughts?
Well, my lord, I am hardly an expert on this sort of thing. But let me think....
Money, power, knowledge? A handsome young smuggler?
Which is?
That's it! Knowledge! Money, power, love, they're all too obvious, but knowledge, what's wrong with wanting a little knowledge?
Ah, yes, here we are. This outpost here used to be occupied by the servants of a powerful Sith.
Supposedly, they left behind a holocron when they abandoned the site in haste. Its contents are probably beneath you, but what Padawan isn't tempted by the lure of forbidden knowledge?
You have a devious mind. I like it.
Good thinking.
I am only glad that I can please you, my lord.
Tempt her into using the holocron, and let its dark side knowledge do the rest?
I think I understand.
Precisely. Once the girl comes over to the dark side, she will do whatever you ask.
Do you think she'll really fall for such a trap?
I don't know....
Simply pique her curiosity. If you can get her alone, your usual techniques of persuasion will prevail.
Of course, you will need to find the holocron first.
She is easily frustrated by difficult things. I think she could be made to doubt her place among the Jedi....
We must make her insecure.
Hmm. Yes. It would be delicate business, but, if I may proffer my most humble opinion, it's a brilliant idea.
Make her feel threatened. Alone and frightened. And then offer yourself as her sole protector in this harsh, cruel galaxy.
I still don't know how I'm going to get her to take me to the ghost.
Plan my next move, Elios.
My lord, if you wish my unworthy opinion, I would suggest preying on the girl's insecurities.
Make her believe you're her only hope in this harsh cruel galaxy.
Of course, you'll still need a way to flush her out of hiding and make the threat seem credible.
Do you have any men you could send to attack her? I could fight them off and win her affection.
Why not stage an attack?
Zash sent me alone, I'm afraid. But that's an excellent thought.
What are you thinking?
Well, it's hardly my area of expertise, but it might just be possible to engage in a little artful deceit.
I don't have all day.
Rumor has it Lord Anathemos of the assassins' pyramid is here in search of a particular holocron.
Now what I'm thinking is, and it may be crazy, you can use that holocron to reach an agreement with Lord Anathemos. For the use of his assassins.
If Lord Anathemos can be bought, I'll buy him.
The deal will be made.
Excellent.
I guess it could work.
I'm sorry I cannot be more helpful, but schemes of this nature are not my area of expertise.
If you can acquire that holocron, Lord Anathemos might be convinced to lay a trap for your Padawan. And when the trap is sprung....
When the trap is sprung, I arrive and save her. Very clever.
I play the hero.
I try only to please, my lord.
That would certainly frighten her, but how would it win me her loyalty?
I'm not sure I understand.
When the time is right, I suggest you arrive and slay the assassins, becoming her savior.
I don't want to kill her, you fool.
I need her alive.
You wouldn't kill her, my lord. At the moment of her greatest danger, you would swoop in and save her.
First, you must recover the holocron and make your deal with Lord Anathemos.
The abandoned outpost is in a nearby region. I'll transfer the location, but be warned, it's swarming with rakghouls and other monstrosities.
We need information on the Padawan from the Jedi training databanks before we can learn how to manipulate her.
Elios Maliss. You were sent here to investigate a ghost. What did you discover?
I am a busy man, I don't have time for--
Oh! My lord! I--I, forgive me, I didn't recognize you in your new wardrobe. So grand.
This is a pleasant surprise. I had heard the most unfortunate rumors.
You're better off not believing anything anyone says about me.
Don't trust rumors.
Yes, of course. The grapevine does lie, doesn't it.
Be careful you don't make that mistake again.
You're forgiven. This time.
Ah, yes, of course, my lord. You are most gracious.
Now, you were asking about the ghost, yes? Let me see. I assure you I've been hard at work assessing the situation.
Just tell me about the ghost.
Yes. The ghost. Of course. Let me see. I assure you I've been working tirelessly, but....
It's just the Jedi have been guarding the old Jedi Enclave very tightly. That's, um, that's where the ghost first appeared, you see.
Let's hope the guardians of the light prove open to negotiation.
I should pay the Jedi a visit.
Dealing with the Jedi may be simple compared to seeing the ghost.
Have there been other appearances in other places?
First appeared?
On the contrary, there have barely been any appearances at all.
Get to the point.
The ghost appears only sporadically. Not even the Jedi who guard the enclave can make it appear.
They've resorted to using a young Padawan to try to draw the ghost out through blood ties or something. Foolishness if you ask me, but I'm a man of meager understanding.
Why do the Jedi care if the ghost appears?
Why do they need to see him?
My understanding is, the ghost doesn't need to appear to be felt, and the Jedi don't like the dark side lingering in their enclave.
Seems if the Padawan can make the ghost appear, they can "cleanse" it--or whatever it is Jedi do with ghosts.
It seems the Jedi have a weak link.
Padawans can be manipulated.
The Jedi guard her closely, but I think you may be on to something.
Many a Sith is formed from a weak Padawan's impressionable mind.
I need this Padawan, too, in that case.
Sounds useful.
If you wish to make the ghost appear, then I'd say it's worth a try.
I need to bind this ghost. How do I make it appear to me?
What about binding the ghost?
Padawans are always the weak link. Young, ambitious, naive.
If you could manipulate this Padawan--her name's Ashara Zavros--into assisting you, you could gain both the ghost and a new apprentice.
I can't imagine an impressionable young Padawan being able to resist your particular charms, and it would save you the trouble of fighting a small army of Jedi.
I cannot twist her until I understand what tempts her.
I must learn her weaknesses.
It's a good suggestion.
I live ever to please. Of course, you'll need to entice her away from her Jedi protectors.
I've done stranger things to get what I want.
If I must.
I assume you'll want to entice her, draw her away from her Jedi protectors.
You might visit the Jedi training grounds by the waterfall. It's abandoned now, dangerous. The data recorders there may hold certain insights into her personality.
In the meantime, I will endeavor to learn what I can of her Jedi Masters.
